settings.discript: GU Hydration Drink Tabs are designed to keep you hydrated during any activity and in all conditions. Tablets are easily dissolved in 16 ounces of water, perfect for dropping into a sport bottle or bike bottle for hydration on-the-go. The light, effervescent tablets are also appropriate for everyday use, during training, travel, and hot weather, or anytime you need a hydration boost. The 12-tablet portable tubes easily fit in pockets, jerseys, and running belts. All flavors are caffeine-free and made with vegan ingredients.

settings.question: WHAT IS HYDRATION?
settings.answer: Hydration is defined as the process of absorbing water. The human body is roughly 60% water, so hydration is crucial for everything you do daily, especially exercise. Without enough hydration, your body lacks the water levels necessary to function optimally, this is called dehydration.

settings.question: WHAT IS PROPER OR OPTIMAL HYDRATION?
settings.answer: Athletes should generally be supplementing water with electrolytes both DURING activity as well as throughout the day. Good hydration is always important, but particularly in the days and weeks before an event or after a hard workout. Use GU Hydration Drink Tabs whenever, wherever, and you'll see a boost in preparation, sustenance, as well as recovery.

settings.question: HOW DO HYDRATION DRINK TABS WORK?
settings.answer: They provide a good balance of fluids and electrolytes. Fluids from water combined with the key electrolyte sodium in our Hydration Drink Tabs help your body hold onto hydration. If you drink water alone, the body will expel it quickly. If you drink water with sodium, the water will hang around longer in your body to help keep you hydrated and prevent dehydration.

settings.question: WHY DOES GU FOCUS PRIMARILY ON SODIUM?
settings.answer: Sodium is the primary electrolyte lost in sweat and crucial to replace during exercise to help avoid dehydration, and a more serious low blood sodium condition known as hyponatremia. Hyponatremia can be life-threatening, and athletes are at a greater risk of developing it either by drinking too much plain water, or by losing too much sodium through sweat.

settings.question: WHY AND WHEN SHOULD YOU USE GU HYDRATION PRODUCTS?
settings.answer: During exercise, you sweat. When you sweat, you lose both fluids (water) and electrolytes (mostly sodium). Inadequate hydration negatively affects performance and can lead to dehydration, or more serious conditions such as hyponatremia. You need to stay on top of hydration during your workout to perform and feel your best.

settings.question: WHAT IS THE SWEETENER IN HYDRATION DRINK TABS?
settings.answer: Organic Stevia, an all-natural plant-based sweetener from the botanical world, and cane sugar.

settings.question: HOW DO I USE HYDRATION DRINK TABS?
settings.answer: Drop. Fizz. Drink. Drop one tablet in a 16oz serving of water, wait for the fizz and enjoy hydration bliss. Rule of thumb: Drink 16-30oz of water every hour during exercise, whether it’s training or racing.

settings.question: HOW DOES THE CAFFEINE IN GU ENERGY GELS HELP ME?
settings.answer: GU Energy Gels and ROCTANE Energy Gels come in both caffeinated and non-caffeinated flavors. Caffeine is more than just a morning pick-me-up. Strategically adding caffeine to your nutrition plan before and during exercise can help keep your mind sharp, decrease perceived effort, boost your endurance, and delay fatigue

settings.question: HOW MANY ELECTROLYTES ARE IN A SERVING OF HYDRATION DRINK TABS?
settings.answer: Each serving of Hydration Drink Tabs contains 320mg of Sodium and 55mg of Potassium.

settings.question: HOW MANY CALORIES ARE IN A SERVING?
ARE HYDRATION DRINK TABS SAFE FOR CHILDREN?
settings.answer: Yes! Hydration Drink Tabs are safe for children.

settings.question: ARE HYDRATION DRINK TABS GLUTEN-FREE AND VEGAN FRIENDLY?
settings.answer: Yes! Hydration Drink Tabs are safe for children.

settings.title: FAQ
settings.richtext: Find the most frequently asked questions below.

settings.heading: 0-1 Hours of effort
settings.text1: For efforts under an hour, it's important to focus on hydration with electrolytes to ensure you feel good both during and after your workout. Water alone can flush through your system without getting to where it needs to go. Replacing sodium helps your system hold your hydration to keep your power output high.

settings.heading: 1 - 2 Hours of effort
settings.text1: When exercising for more than an hour, it's important to replenish fluids and electrolytes along the way to avoid dehydration. Dehydration makes it hard for your heart to circulate blood, which lowers your power output and increases your perceived effort. Along with fluids, add Energy Gels to your plan to replenish the carbs you burn.

settings.heading: 2-3 Hours of effort
settings.text1: For long efforts, particularly in hot, dry, or humid conditions, you sweat more. Replenishing the sodium you lose along with ample fluids is essential feeling good and keeping your power output high. It's also important to refuel with easily digestible carbohydrates along the way by eating one Energy Gel every 45 minutes.

settings.heading: 3-4  Hours of effort
settings.text1: For long efforts, particularly in hot, dry, or humid conditions, you sweat more. Replenishing the sodium you lose along with ample fluids is essential feeling good and keeping your power output high. It's also important to refuel with easily digestible carbohydrates along the way by eating one Energy Gel every 45 minutes.

settings.heading: 4-5 Hours of effort
settings.text1: For long efforts, particularly in hot, dry, or humid conditions, you sweat more.
